Assign data-set from a package directly to a variable

Source: R/import_data.R
import_data.Rd

The import_data() function gets a specified data set from a package.
Unlike utils::data(), the import_data() function returns the data set directly, and allows assigning the data set like so:
mydata <- import_data(...).

import_data(dataname, package, lib.loc = .libPaths())

Arguments

dataname

a single string, giving the name of the data set.

package

the quoted package name.

lib.loc

character vector specifying library search path (the location of R library trees to search through).
This is usually .libPaths().
See also loadNamespace.

Value

Returns the data directly. Thus, one can assign the data like so: mydata <- import_data(...).

See also

tinyoperations_import()

Examples


d <- import_data("chicago", "gamair")
head(d)
#>   death pm10median pm25median  o3median  so2median    time tmpd
#> 1   130 -7.4335443         NA -19.59234  1.9280426 -2556.5 31.5
#> 2   150         NA         NA -19.03861 -0.9855631 -2555.5 33.0
#> 3   101 -0.8265306         NA -20.21734 -1.8914161 -2554.5 33.0
#> 4   135  5.5664557         NA -19.67567  6.1393413 -2553.5 29.0
#> 5   126         NA         NA -19.21734  2.2784649 -2552.5 32.0
#> 6   130  6.5664557         NA -17.63400  9.8585839 -2551.5 40.0
